text: The ecojulia org has it’s own homepage (<http://ecojulia.org|ecojulia.org>) built with Franklin from this repository <https://github.com/EcoJulia/EcoJulia.org> . Now all of the packages under the org have docs built with Documenter, which puts them at e.g. <https://ecojulia.github.io/SimpleSDMLayers.jl/stable/> , though we’d like them to be at <https://ecojulia.org/SimpleSDMLayers.jl/stable/> . The synonymisation inside github (repo settings) seems not to work, at least it errors. Anyone knows how to do this?

text: <@UC2AEGPC2> I think you’ve done something like this for BioJulia, right?

elements.text: I think you’ve done something like this for BioJulia, right?

text: I didn't do Franklin, I used Hugo Academic. I don't quite remember the synonymisation stuff. I think once I had it done for <http://biojulia.github.io|biojulia.github.io> repo it worked for all package URLs as well.

elements.text: I didn't do Franklin, I used Hugo Academic. I don't quite remember the synonymisation stuff. I think once I had it done for
repo it worked for all package URLs as well.

text: I set all that up with namecheap as there were some pretty easy instructions on how to set it up for gh-pages at the time.

text: OK, thanks, maybe that is actually the way to go, to just synonymize the whole domain :slightly_smiling_face: I’ll check it out!
